isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION SHIFT LINKAGE - OPERATION

svcproc.title: OPERATION
svcproc.para: The parking brake hand valve must be pushed in to release the brake on the propeller shaft. When the vehicle is in the "P" (Park-Neutral) position, it is protected from accidental shifting by a brake interlock system. To release the shift lever from the "P" (Park-Neutral) position, the brake pedal must be depressed to energize the shift lock relays. This allows the solenoid to be energized, drawing the plunger from the locked position, allowing the driver to select the desired shift position. To place the vehicle in park, simply shift to the "P" (Park-Neutral) position, and the shift lever is locked into the "P" (Park-Neutral) position by the spring loaded plunger.
